result.execSummary:
The defendant Devontae L Kohnke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expunction will be granted on all three misd counts if deft successfully completes probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with victims.  DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
Concurrent to Count 1 of 15CF882.
Unpaid financial obligations are rolled into sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devontae L Kohnke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amended cover page to transcript dated 5/1/17 correcting case number.

Minutes:  15CF882/15CM1112.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Ben Schwarz.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  

15CF882 - Ct 1 - deft sentenced to 6-1/2 yrs WSP; initial confinement of 18mos followed by 5yrs of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Credit for 260 days.  Deft is not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Ct 2 - sentenced to 10 days KCJ concurrent.  Any unpaid financial obligations on count 2 shall be rolled into sentence. 

15CM1112 - deft sentenced to 50 days KCJ concurrent to count 1 of 15CF882.  Any unpaid financial obligations shall be rolled into sentence.  

Appeal rights.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  15CF882/15CM1112/15CM1113.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Wm. Michel.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.

15CF882 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 3-1/2yrs.  See conditions.

15CM1112 & 15CM1113 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 2yrs.  See conditions.  Restitution is ordered (15CM1113); deft stipulates to restitution amount in the amount of $2167.87.  To be paid during probation.  In default, deft may be subject to contempt charges.  Deft sentenced to 30 days KCJ commencing today as a condition of probation on 15CM1113.  

Probation sentences are concurrent to each other.   
Appeal rights.
DNA ordered; notice given to deft
Firearm warning
Expunction will be granted on all three misd. counts if deft successfully completes probation.

Minutes:  15CF882/15CM1112/15CM1113.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Wm. Michel.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  

15CF882 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 2; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed & read-in on State's motion.  

15CM1112 - deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.

15CM1113 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 is dismissed & read-in on State's motion.

PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 11/19/15 @ 11am.

Minutes:  15CF882/15CM1112/15CM1113.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Wm. Michel.  Mutual request for an adjournment; misd. files were resolved but deft picked up new felony charges.  FPT adj to 10/12/15 @ 1:15pm on all files.  JS to remain as previously fixed - 10/19/15 @ 9am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA James Kraus

135pm  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk: NJurgens.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Deft demands jury trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 09:40 am.  Jury selection scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.  $1500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  kmk
and witness list filed by the State  kmk
